result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ricardo Tapia has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Motion to modify bail
  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 3/30/22 - Schedule a bail hearing.**
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to use any social media to include SnapChat and Facebook.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

01:19 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jensen Jr.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Jensen would like to address probable cause and makes arguments as he does not believe there is probable cause to move forward.  The State responds to Attorney Jensen's arguments relating to probable cause.  The Court will deny Attorney Jensen's motion.  Attorney Jensen is requesting a preliminary hearing date on the same date as the defendant's other preliminary hearing.  The Court will schedule the preliminary hearing on the same date as the defendant's other hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
